channel.title: Adding new Global Objects
channel.description:
I forgot what the numbers mean when adding global objects. maybe u all can help me out? [code]public void NewObjects() {
makeGlobalObject(2510, 3863, 2783, 0, 10);// Anvil makeGlobalObject(2843, 2964, 61, -3, 10); // Ancient Alter makeGlobalObject(3042, 4843, 2781, 0, 10);// Furnace makeGlobalObject(2378, 3438, 2287, -2, 10);// Obstacle Pipe [/code] i know the first 2 sets of numbers are the coords and i know the 4th set of number(s) is which direction its facing but whats the 3rd and 5th sets of number(s) do?

3rd = Item ID. 5th = Type.

item.title: Adding new Global Objects
item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

I forgot what the numbers mean when adding global objects. maybe u all can help me out?

[code]public void NewObjects() {

    makeGlobalObject(2510, 3863, 2783, 0, 10);// Anvil
    makeGlobalObject(2843, 2964, 61, -3, 10); // Ancient Alter
    makeGlobalObject(3042, 4843, 2781, 0, 10);// Furnace 
    makeGlobalObject(2378, 3438, 2287, -2, 10);// Obstacle Pipe

[/code]
i know the first 2 sets of numbers are the coords and i know the 4th set of number(s) is which direction its facing but whats the 3rd and 5th sets of number(s) do?

Read full topic
